summary.problem: os.fchmod() is not available on Windows, causing save() to fail with AttributeError
summary.solution: Wrapped os.fchmod call with contextlib.suppress(AttributeError, OSError) to gracefully handle Windows and filesystems that don't support chmod
summary.approach: Minimal fix using existing contextlib import to suppress both AttributeError (Windows) and OSError (unsupported filesystems)

risks: On Windows, temp files will use default umask permissions instead of 0o600
limitations: Windows doesn't support Unix-style file permissions, so restrictive permissions cannot be guaranteed on that platform
